lenders.name: HUWIB
lenders.loan_because: The Harvard Undergraduate Women In Business club is hosting its annual Intercollegiate Business Convention. The convention's mission is to bring together undergraduate women with an interest in business to share ideas, build business skills, and meet industry leaders. Many women come out of IBC with not only a host of new friends from different schools and universities, but also valuable business connections to help them find internships and post-college jobs! This year we have decided to donate some of the  ticket profits to KIVA. We hope to promote female entrepreneurship all over the world.
lenders.occupational_info: HUWIB is currently the largest undergraduate business organization on campus at Harvard, reaching over 300 members. The organization seeks to empower a dynamic group of enterprising young women by uniting them through business education and experience. Through panels, conferences, outreach initiatives, skill-building workshops, leadership projects, and mentorship programs, HUWIB seeks to expose undergraduate women to a variety of business careers.

lenders.name: Solomon Onyango
lenders.loan_because:
I do believe it is important to disclose that I was once employed and my terms were void of any pension able benefit. At the time of my employment, I had a very cordial relationship with my bankers but when I did present this current proposal, they declined as my account was not performing consistently as before and to make it worse they kindly requested a tangible security to accompany it. 
sincerely,
lenders.occupational_info:
Hi,
My name is Solomon Onyango. I am a Kenyan citizen working for an electronic money transfer company.
This is a service accorded by a local mobile service company to serve its clientele by enabling them to remit money to friends and relatives through text instructions. This is made possible through the company's appointed agents all over the country who receive and pay funds on demand.
As an administrator of a local agent in my locality called KATITO, it has come to my realization that it’s strenuous for an agent to provide money services cum top-up call cards hence my interest to supply the locals with top up cards.
I have two boys who are through with schooling and would like to engage them in distribution of these top-up cards by way of bicycles which is the local mode of transport.
The area to be covered is on a 20 km radius and encompasses the environ of people settled around the lake. The essence is that local fishermen log on the internet to check  the prevailing market prices as to keep abreast with knowledge of bargaining so as not to be exploited by the middlemen roaming the beaches.
 
The bone of contention is affordability of these top up cards! Mobile service providers have various denominations at the disposal of their subscribers and the affordable, cheapest denomination comes in kshs 50 and kshs 20. By conversion, 1 dollar equals kshs 65 at current going rate.
Internet connectivity provided by the mobile operators is affordable and a credit top up of kshs 20 can accord one 20 minutes of browsing.
 
My main focus is to set up a supply chain to the locals of top-up cards of denominations of 50 and 20 with a daily supply of 3500 cards reaching all. This will be in breakdowns of 1000 cards in 50 denominator and 2500 cards in 20 denominators.
 
The 3500 purchase is meant to reach 48 outlets everyday by quick access with bicycles. It is important to note that the main economic activities comprise fishing at the Lake Victoria , cattle trade, cross border complimentary business and peasant subsistence farming.
 
 To factor on viability of my project, I would tabulate as follows:
                Card of kshs 50 = 2.50 commission
                Card of kshs 20 = 1.00 commission
Hence;
                1000 cards of kshs 50 = 100 * 2.50 = 2500
                2500 cards of kshs 20 = 2000 * 1 = 2000
                                                      Total    = 4500
 
I hereby do approach KIVA as an organization to solicit for me 2000 dollars to help me start up this noble idea in conjunction with my jobless sons
I was introduced to yourselves by Mr. Martin Opondo who is a community worker with AMREF  KENYA (REF: opondoobwar@gmail.com)

lenders.name: MAGDI
lenders.loan_because:
Hi

My name is Magdi Bunt and I am living in South Africa.
I have been working as an instructor and an educator for the past 8 years. I am currently
tutoring kids in my small place and making them more able to learn. In Africa education
is quite a problem and I am teaching people to read and write properly. I am a dedicated
and this is what I would like to do in my life. 
I would like to open and rent out a larger premises where I can have the opportunity to
teach and tutor more kids and people at the same time. At the moment I do not have
enough funds to rent out a larger space and I would like to loan money for this.
Currently I am tutoring from home where I can fit 4 people in my very small dining area. 
I am 30 years old, happily married. And I have helped hundreds of kids and youth as well
parents to be literate and have given them an opportunity to live a better life by teaching
them how to read and write as well as raising their study abilities. 
I love what I am doing but I can’t manage to rent an office from my pay. 
I saw this wonderful opportunity on the Oprah show and I would like make use of this
opportunity because it will give me a good start to build up my “Dream” tutoring and
education centre here in this province or area.
I love to help people and I have dedicated my life to do this. However I would like to take
my small tutoring school to a higher level where more youth will have the opportunity to
get educated and find jobs. 
Please put me on your pages for loans. 

Best Regards, Magdi Bunt
lenders.occupational_info: I am Instructing children and youth with learning difficulties and make them more able and raise their study abilities.

lenders.loan_because: I want to help families and groups in the Middle East who are trying to bring services, small businesses, schools, and health services to impoverished communities where hope needs to be sparked.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a teacher of 12-14 year olds, and I aim to help them understand, not only reading and writing, but how to recognize the way power dynamics relate to events in both history and our world today.

lenders.name: Joy
lenders.loan_because: Everyone needs a little help.  It is amazing to see the impact of a small amount of money in the hands of someone who really needs it.
lenders.occupational_info: Supporting children who have autism through effective treatment programs.

lenders.name: Elizabeth and Justin
lenders.loan_because: We care.

lenders.name: E.Z.
lenders.loan_because: I hope to see the day when people will no longer need loans to better their lives
lenders.occupational_info: Shari'a compliant finance is another form of ethical financing, but based on Islamic Law (Shari'a)

lenders.name: scottforlily
lenders.loan_because: This is my brand new account for my one year old daughter Lily. My main account is at http://www.kiva.org/lender/saabnet
lenders.occupational_info: I tease Lily as often as possible. She loves it.

lenders.name: Matts @ NordIQ
lenders.loan_because: I want to support entrepreneurship. And contribute enabling people with small economic possibilities.
lenders.occupational_info:
We work with energy efficiency and smart district heating.
I want to be social resposible.
I think you need not be idéalist to promote CSR - you can do it for profitability!

lenders.name: Pål (Paul)
lenders.loan_because: Hoping to contribute to a change for the better on the individual level.
lenders.occupational_info: Bettering the world for under privileged children.

lenders.name: Michael & Norma
lenders.loan_because: We believe that providing people with realistic employment opportunities and skills is one of the most effective ways of combating poverty in our world.
lenders.occupational_info:
Michael oversees the transportation and delivery of food products across North America.  

Norma handles office and administrative functions for a small government office dealing with health-related issues.

lenders.name: lars
lenders.loan_because: It's the obvious thing to do when you are able to.
lenders.occupational_info: I make websites.

lenders.name: Jasper
lenders.loan_because: I let the beauty of what I love be what I do.

lenders.name: Zsuzsanna
lenders.loan_because: it is a small contribution to a better world
lenders.occupational_info: I follow and guide a "life" of a product from design, through production , untill it reaches the endconsumer..

lenders.name: Jason
lenders.loan_because: We're one family.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in computer support.

lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.loan_because: the impact is real and it is big
lenders.occupational_info: evaluate loan request for new and growing small businesses in the US

lenders.name: Robyn
lenders.loan_because: I care for others and feel that i can make a difference in the world by helping others that are less fortunte than i am.
lenders.occupational_info: I try to study hard and do the best i can do in my school work.

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: Recommended by a friend. By far the best way to reach people who want to help themselves.

lenders.name: Jay Couture
lenders.loan_because: I care,  and I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I am in sales, and I am a student in the IT field.

lenders.name: Jan
lenders.loan_because: I believe in creating opportunities, not giving hand-outs, in order for people to better themselves.

lenders.name: Tim
lenders.loan_because: I want to be decent.
lenders.occupational_info: I plant trees, lay brick, and create gardens.

lenders.name: Selina
lenders.loan_because: It's worth it!
lenders.occupational_info: Educating myself and others

lenders.name: Laura B.
lenders.loan_because: it's time to share what we fortunate Canadians have.

lenders.name: Hans-Dieter
lenders.loan_because: I am happy to be in a position that I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I am selling hardware for computers to European customers

lenders.name: AnnMarie
lenders.loan_because:
I am fortunate to have a good life and successful career, and I've been able to travel the world.  I try to give to the people and communities I visit.  Lending through Kiva is a great way to enable others.

In the words of Mahatma Gandhi “Be the change you want to see in the world.”
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a large company and develop new products used in life science research.

lenders.name: damphoux
lenders.loan_because: At one point in my life all I had was the courage to try.  The money came later.  Money though, would have gotten me here faster.
lenders.occupational_info: Building a better world for our future generations by supporting fair, green and entrepreneurial practices.

lenders.name: Henry World School
lenders.loan_because: The students of Henry World School believe it is both an opportunity and obligation to create a better and more peaceful world.
lenders.occupational_info: Henry World school is a 6 - 8 grade urban middle school in the Denver Public Schools.  We are affiliated with the Middle Years Programme of the International Baccalaureate Organization and, as such, feel strongly about our place in the world and our commitment to our fellow human beings.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: I believe that everyone deserves a "leg up" not a "hand out"
lenders.occupational_info: I administrate insurance for the Catholic Churches in my area.

lenders.name: jessica
lenders.loan_because: Interesting way to help people and maybe one day I will need this help.

lenders.name: Liron
lenders.loan_because:
The reason I loan is because, no matter how hard my financial status is right now, I know that there are people out there who are actually *starving*. I can only give a little at a time but I know that my few dollars mean a lot to somebody else. 
God Bless.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a college student. When I am not studying, I work for my father but with school, I don't have a lot of time to work.

lenders.name: Telmo
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the transformational role of microcredit for the lives of many people.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a professor of psychotherapy and a clinician.

lenders.name: YOUTHINVESTORSANDGIVERS
lenders.loan_because: To teach our Youth Investors the importance of investing and giving back.
lenders.occupational_info:
THE TIME IS NOW
THE FUTURE IS NOW !

INVESTING IN OUR YOUTH WHILE TEACHING INVESTING AND GIVING TO CHARITIES

lenders.name: Brett
lenders.loan_because: I want to enable people to help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I sell computer software to companies to help them stay secure and well managed.

lenders.name: Sasha
lenders.loan_because: i want to do something useful with my money, and not just have it sit around
lenders.occupational_info: im a student

lenders.name: Jin
lenders.loan_because: it does not take a lot to give kids of many hard working Kiva parents a chance for a better future.
lenders.occupational_info: I enjoy applying technology to improve life of others.

lenders.name: Andrea Griffith
lenders.loan_because: I am an entrepreneur and know how tough it is to get funding.  I believe everyone who has a great vision and is willing to work hard should be allowed the opportunity to turn that dream into a reality.  Owning a business isn't easy and it isn't for everyone.  I am inspired by the stories of  those who refuse to give up and actually make it happen.  I hope I can contribute to that success (in a small way) for someone who really believes in themselves and their contribution to the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Television News Anchor/Reporter, turned media entrepreneur, turned publishing/online executive.

lenders.name: Kaitlyn
lenders.loan_because: it is the right thing to do and my geography teacher st this up as a project
lenders.occupational_info: i am a freshman in high school.

lenders.name: Ruth & Sergio
lenders.loan_because: my husband gave me $25 in loan money as a birthday gift. It's a start :).

lenders.name: Elaine
lenders.loan_because: I want to help as many people in life as I can.

lenders.name: Jean-Claude
lenders.loan_because: it makes a difference.

lenders.name: In Memory of Larry Dodge
lenders.loan_because: Larry Dodge's life work was to impact the local and global community for the better.  His cousin, Judy Penhiter, generously started us on this micro lending jouney to help us continue his work.

lenders.name: Ashling
lenders.loan_because: I want to help someone who could have been my mother, my sister, my uncle. We are all tied together: I can walk only if others can stand on their own feet, I can sing only if others can raise their voices, too.

lenders.name: Vanessa & Steve
lenders.loan_because: We want to be citizens of the world and share our resources.
lenders.occupational_info: We are foster parents to severely emotionally disturbed teenagers, Steve is also a high school teacher, teaching spanish and english literature.

lenders.name: Scott & Alice
lenders.occupation: Surf Shop Manager / Breast Milk Donations
lenders.loan_because: because we can!  This is an opportunity to really make a difference in someone's life.  It's also FUN!

lenders.name: Caroline
lenders.loan_because: I want to lend a hand...
lenders.occupational_info: Eye doctor

lenders.name: Bill H
lenders.loan_because: I want to take some small part in eliminating extreme poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: I build software companies.

lenders.name: Molly
lenders.loan_because: I believe in small things making all the difference.

lenders.name: Juliet
lenders.loan_because: i want to help people

lenders.name: Delia
lenders.loan_because: Because everyone deserves a chance to prove themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people become better sales persons.

lenders.name: simcha
lenders.loan_because: if i am not going to give, who will?
lenders.occupational_info: dust, dust.

lenders.name: Chamsi for Quote Couture
lenders.loan_because: I feel drawn to empowering women in Africa because it is the most disadvantaged socio-economic demographic group in the world. And I believe micro lending is one of the most sustainable ways to end extreme poverty in the world.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am the Founder & Design Director (Creative & UX) of Quote Couture. I enjoy designing beautiful quote wear that inspires people, and spreads positive vibes into the world. I also enjoy using a portion of the Quote Couture profits to empower women entrepreneurs in Africa. I am a top 1% lender on Kiva.
Shop http://www.quote-couture.com so, together, we can have a greater positive impact on the world.

I am also the co-frounder of team Africa. We are 150+ members strong, and in the top 2% teams on Kiva. Join me there: http://www.kiva.org/team/africa.

lenders.name: Audrey
lenders.loan_because: it's the right thing to do ~ someone once gave me a break.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm the CFO of a small US company ~ which means I do everything!  Accounting, operations management, HR, etc

lenders.name: Katherine
lenders.loan_because:
"Man was made for action, and to promote by the exertion of his faculties such changes in the external circumstances both of himself and others, as may seem most favourable to the happiness of all."
-Adam Smith

lenders.name: Joel
lenders.loan_because: ‘Truly I tell you, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers and sisters of mine, you did for me.’

lenders.name: Michel Virard
lenders.loan_because: I have been an entrepreneur and I know what it is to beg for a bank loan in order to get started. I did get my loan, thanks to the Canadian banking system. Now I think it is time I help other entrepreneurs with less opportunities. I want to help those who have faith in themselves and are not waiting for a divinity to do the job.
lenders.occupational_info: I help Canadian companies to make applications for Scientific Research & Technical Developpement grants and tax credits.

lenders.name: Martyn
lenders.loan_because: I want to give back.
lenders.occupational_info: I consult to Cable TV providers around the world on best practice operational process and procedures, with a strong focus on Customer Care and Billing, together with the IT systems to support them.

lenders.name: Hillary
lenders.occupation: Business Owner, Yoga Teacher, Speaker and Writer
lenders.loan_because: others have helped me along my way. When we give we receive more in life. There is joy in giving and to help those who was seeking ways to find freedom I am happy to be involved.
lenders.occupational_info: I have a company called - I am not a Mess!  that creates products like yoga dvds, books as well as on-line content that helps others to become empowered through using a challenge in life as a platform for wellness.

lenders.name: Hannah
lenders.loan_because: I'd rather spend my money on other people than fritter it away on more books.

lenders.name: Kelly
lenders.loan_because: The microlending system is empowering!
lenders.occupational_info: I teach and do research in health and wellness.

lenders.name: uranda wanyu
lenders.occupational_info: health care, body-mind work,consuling,social work,

lenders.name: Bobby & Stacey
lenders.loan_because: A rising tide raises all boats.
lenders.occupational_info: She is a registered nurse.  He writes for television.  We raise two kids.  And sometimes we take ridiculous photos of ourselves hugging.

lenders.name: Vanessa
lenders.loan_because: I love to help out and support those that don't have access to the same opportunities that we do.
lenders.occupational_info: I like to empower people to make positive change in their lives so that they can live an authentic life.  I'm currently gaining qualifications for becoming a Kinesiologist and I create beautiful and unique jewellery.
